channel.title: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?
channel.description:
"Receive feedback of abilities used on target tonight. Will not receive feedback for conversions or attacks."
I just played a game where I got a knight executed who claimed to be guarding the prince because my gossip showed nothing when I used it on the prince. Does the "You watched over [X]" not show up on gossip? If so, which abilities do show up? I'm so confused :S
EDIT: Perhaps this could be in bugs, but I get the feeling that I'm just missing something. Also just to confirm, I wasn't debbed/occed/converted the same night, the knight did not claim occupied, and the CW says he was on another target all game.

item.title: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:

If you use the ability on the Noble’s target then the Noble get’s that feedback.

item.source: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?

item.title: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?
item.dc:creator: Shurian
item.description:
Navi:

Okay, so the way it works is if the target would receive feedback from an ability used on them by someone else, then I would see all of them?

So, for instance:

[1] is a physician, who is healing [4]

[2] is a sheriff, who is investigating [4]

[3] is an assassin, who is assassinating [4]

[4] is anything BD, doing nothing.

If on that same night, I use gossip on [4], all I would see is “You were healed last night”?

Or should I see “[4] was attacked last night so you healed them” and “[4] is not suspicious”?

You healed [4] last night.
[4] is not suspicious.

Read full topic
item.source: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?

item.title: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
You would see both of the messages the Physician and Sheriff recieve. You are correct in your assessment of the ability, and I think it’s fair to ping @Ellie on this one. Seems like a bug to me, unless he left that message out on purpose for fake-claiming purposes.

Read full topic
item.source: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?

item.title: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
You never know if a knight guards you, so your target wouldn’t get that feedback

Read full topic

item.title: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?
item.dc:creator: Navi
item.description:
But if it’s abilities used ON target, wouldn’t it show everything that targeted them, not what the target does? If that is the way it works it should read “Receive feedback of abilities used BY target tonight”, right?

item.source: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?

item.title: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?
item.dc:creator: Htm
item.description:
Navi:

Okay, so the way it works is if the target would receive feedback from an ability used on them by someone else, then I would see all of them?

So, for instance:

[1] is a physician, who is healing [4]

[2] is a sheriff, who is investigating [4]

[3] is an assassin, who is assassinating [4]

[4] is anything not death immune, doing nothing.

No you only see it 1 time if it makes sense. It isn’t like an observer.

For example you would see: “You (the knight) watched over X” If you used it on the knight

Read full topic

item.title: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?
item.dc:creator: Htm
item.description:
This is what I got off the wiki

Mechanics
Gossip will return the feedback of any abilities used on your target, exception feedback from conversion or attacks. This can be something like “[Target] is a member of the Unseen!” but will not include messages like “You converted [Target] to the Unseen last night.”

Read full topic
item.source: How does the Noble's new Gossip ability work?
